children.subject: We would prefer that ASEs have taken 16A, so they are familiar with the way we teach the material.
Would students that didn't take 16A(because of Math 54) and went directly into 16B and achieved a high grade(A/A+) be considered or only students that took 16a?
16B is only required for TA positions. We don't require ASEs to have taken the class for a letter grade.
<md>If I'm in the class this semester or p/np am I still eligible? Is 16b required?</md>

history.content:
Hi everybody!

Applications for EECS 16A course staff for the Fall 2021 semester are now available! We have a variety of roles available, and all positions are paid. 

Anyone who has taken the course is invited to apply for Reader and Group Tutor positions; both readers and tutors are considered Academic Student Employees (ASEs). Readers will be responsible for grading homework and debugging exams, and tutors may assist in lab sections, office hours, or homework parties.

If you have prior experience teaching 16A or TAing another course and would like to apply for a TA position, please also fill out both forms linked below and mark your interest in becoming a TA.

Anyone interested in joining course staff should fill out the interest form here by Sunday, May 2nd at 11:59 p.m. in addition to the department application form found here. 

If you have any specific questions about being on course staff, feel free to post a follow-up discussion below. Thank you!
